score.title: Class D: The last job you'll ever need
paragraphs: TransGalaxy Pangalactic Corporation. One of the largest and most powerful entities in the galaxy. Though the Company has their fingers in everything these days, they started out as a shipping service, and that's still a core part of their business.

Class D Shipping Division. The difficult and hazardous cargo section of the Company's shipping arm. Home of the desperate, the unqualified, and the just plain stupid. That's where you ended up, most likely through fault of your own. The Company buys whatever junkers they can find for cheap, hires anyone who applies, insures the Hell out of the whole thing, and crosses their fingers that you losers can deliver enough hazardous cargo to hostile destinations to make it worth their while.
You are so desperate, such a fuck-up, or so insane that you took on this job. Unfortunately, so are your crewmates and so is your captain. Best of luck surviving your five-year contract!

notes.title: Arsubaran
elements: Basically human, just with crazier hair colors.

notes.title: Dolom
elements: Big, strong blue people with three arms legs, radially symmetrical. The face is on just one side though.

notes.title: Hacragorkan
elements: Burly brutes with green skin, scarification, and tattoos. They like to hit stuff.

notes.title: Ken Reeg
elements: Like Arsubarans with green skin, but well known as smarmy con-artists.

notes.title: Robot
elements: Yep, you can be a robot. We know, robots aren't a species. Where else were we going to put them?

notes.title: Ryjyllian
elements: Honor-bound feline people, they usually work as mercenaries and muscle for hire.

notes.title: Saldrallan
elements: Primary species in one of the galactic empires. Like a giant snake with arms.

notes.title: Templar
elements: AKA Devalkamanchans. Bosses of the other empire. Bald, purple and super racist.

notes.title: Tetsuashan
elements: Great big one-eyed slugs. Good pilots, though.

notes.title: Urseminite
elements: The worst. Like sociopathic ambulatory teddy bears.
